title: Regression when compiling with 07-14 nightly

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust pub struct Record<'a> { pub args: &'a [(usize, &'a str)], } mod a { extern "Rust" { fn foo(record: &super::Record); } } mod b { extern "Rust" { fn foo(record: &super::Record); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.64.0-nightly (c2f428d2f 2022-07-14) binary: rustc commit-hash: c2f428d2f3340a0e7d995f4726223db91b93704c commit-date: 2022-07-14 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.64.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', /rustc/c2f428d2f3340a0e7d995f4726223db91b93704c\compiler\rustc_middle\src\ty\sty.rs:1000:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff9c84a9d2f - rustc_trait_selection[fd3e0aafddcc0eaa]::traits::type_known_to_meet_bound_modulo_regions 13: 0x7ff9ca6ce20e - ::visit_ty 14: 0x7ff9ca6cd97e - ::visit_ty 15: 0x7ff9cabe2c7a - >::encode 16: 0x7ff9cab3929c - >::encode 17: 0x7ff9c9676690 - <&rustc_index[1917152cef6eef0]::vec::IndexVec as rustc_serialize[c3cf2e54bbdda217]::serialize::Decodable>::decode 18: 0x7ff9cafc72da - ::is_sized 19: 0x7ff9cb02edd9 - ::fold_region 20: 0x7ff9cb03d21b - ::check_crate 33: 0x7ff9c98da1dc - ::check_crate 34: 0x7ff9c98da191 - ::check_crate 35: 0x7ff9c98dac0d - ::check_foreign_item 36: 0x7ff9c8b9d853 - rustc_interface[d38a371e72ccadf5]::callbacks::setup_callbacks 37: 0x7ff9c9a653c1 - <&[rustc_span[b3b8b508e7cd26ef]::def_id::DefId] as rustc_serialize[c3cf2e54bbdda217]::serialize::Decodable>::decode 48: 0x7ff9c96ea0b6 - <&rustc_index[1917152cef6eef0]::vec::IndexVec as rustc_serialize[c3cf2e54bbdda217]::serialize::Decodable>::decode 49: 0x7ff9c96364ef - ::fmt 52: 0x7ff9c8b45a55 - 53: 0x7ff9c8b5e107 - rustc_driver[39d376d6076eb2]::args::arg_expand_all 54: 0x7ff9c8b47469 - 55: 0x7ff9c8b483ed - ::fmt 56: 0x7ff9c84bf02c - std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new::hdddbeea900b2c6ad 57: 0x7ffa666d3fed - BaseThreadInitThunk 58: 0x7ffa67a942a8 - RtlUserThreadStart error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.64.0-nightly (c2f428d2f 2022-07-14) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [is_sized_raw] computing whether `[(usize, &str)]` is `Sized` #1 [layout_of] computing layout of `&[(usize, &str)]` #2 [layout_of] computing layout of `Record<'_>` #3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```

Playground uses 7-13 nightly still, and the code compiles there: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=acd29a81c627ac9cd863a0a3d843c72e
